Reviews.Title: “Great, clean and well worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Westchesternyed
Reviews.Content: Fairfield Inns may not be Marriott' s top of the line, but If you need a place to stay just before Baltimore that is new, immacate and has great service, then his is the place. The conti e real breakfast was more than continental and the hotel is very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new. Rooms spotless. Bathrooms spotless. Many free amenities”
Reviews.Author: njskiiier
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with teenage daughter for soccer tourny. Easy parking. C/I no hassle. Hot beverages, fresh apples, water w/lemons all waiting for you in lobby. Nice. Room small but comfortable and linens and bedspreads smell beautifully CLEAN. Free wi fi. Pantene Hair Products. Free continental brkfast w/ waffles, yogurt, cereal, fresh fruits, hot oatmeal, microwaveable egg sandwiches and brkfast burritos, muffins, toast,fresh fruit, juices, milks, etc etc. A bit cramped as many teams there and not much seating as half is bar stool/table seating. Nice big TV in area. Microwave available for use during day. Gym small but new and clean w/ new LifeCycle equipment, water, sanitizing wipes, towels. 24 hrs a day. Laundry facilities free and will give you detergent. Ice machine and beverage machine w/ popular drinks like Arizona IT and Gatorade in it. Business center in front area w/ printer and two terminals. Outdoor pool facility- too cold did not check it out. Nearby walking distance-- taco bell and mcD' and a walk in dr office Free shuttle to area shopping dining that runs all day into late evening.White Marsh Mall and other stores w/ just about every store you could think of including IKEA. NO PETS.

Reviews.Title: “Better Customer Service at the Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: SpringFling2011
Reviews.Content: I had an opportunity to stay at this hotel recently and was surprised at the nonchalant attitude of the young lady at the front desk ( 02/02 9-5 shift). Normally, Marriott hotel staff members are gracious and hospitable...my suggestion...one more review of the customer service manual as it could really make a difference. I had to prompt her to share information on the hotel... breakfast hours, workout center. The accomodations were great... too bad the personnel (day shift) was not a reflection of standard Marriott quality... Signed, A customer that hopes personnel receives better training...

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Fairfield I have seen to date”
Reviews.Author: RichieCMontreal
Reviews.Content: I staid here on my way while driving down to Florida last week from Montreal. This is actually the perfect place to stop as it is right before you hit the traffic of Baltimore and Washington at exit 67. The service was great as check in took no more than three minutes. This is a very impressive property, in fact it is the nicest Fairfield Inn I have seen to date. The hotel is new and spotlessly clean. The lobby is nicely decorated and they have a nice touch by offering you a glass of water with lemon as you check in at the front desk. The rooms are well decorated and spotless clean. The bathroom is typical of what you would expect from a Fairfield and was perfectly clean. The room came equipped with a 42" HD television. There is free wireless internet which was very fast. The beds were comfortable with good linens. Unfortunately we left too early to try the complimentary breakfast but if it is like anything else in this hotel I am sure it is good. The location is great as the area around the hotel has shopping malls restaurants and many other things. This is a great place to stay and I highly recommend it passing through Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for quick stop over”
Reviews.Author: michellef16
Reviews.Content: My husband, 8-month old son and I stopped here on our way home from South Carolina. It was a very clean hotel and the bed was exactly what we needed. The breakfast was amazing. Definitely a little pricey for the amount of time we were there (less than 10 hours) but was over all nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Extremely Clean”
Reviews.Author: Lunamoth2001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Fairfield Inn and Suites near the White Marsh Mall outside of Baltimore with two friends. The hotel is very new and extremely clean. They have a shuttle that will bring you back and forth to the mall or any of the nearby restaurants. In addition, you are able to walk to the mall if you wish to. There is also public transportation into Baltimore nearby which we took advantage of so we didn't have to drive into town. We stayed in a queen suite which was very nice, two queen beds and a sofa bed. The suite also had a mini fridge, a microwave and a coffee maker. The staff was very helpful. The only downfall of the room was that there is no exhaust fan in the bathroom which made it very hot and steamy. We also spent time at the pool which has a lifeguard stationed at all times (great for parents). The breakfast was pretty good as hotel continental breakfasts go. Of course there was not enough seating and kids were running around, but that's typical for this type of setting. Overall it was an excellent experience and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good overnight stop”
Reviews.Author: Steve328is
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night just passing through. The hotel appears fairly new. It was spotless everywhere we looked. Quick, easy check-in and -out. The room was 'right-sized' for our needs, and well appointed. There is an Ikea store across the road and the furnishings in the room look like they could have come from there. The only issue--and this is barely worth mentioning--is there was no exhaust fan in the bathroom. Leave the door open a bit and there's no problem. The breakfast is standard Fairfield, but once again the breakfast area was kept spotless and the quality of the food was just a little better than I've experienced at other Fairfield inns. Easy access from I-95, and a gas station, mcdonalds, and taco bell are within walking distance. White Marsh town center is across the road with plenty of other eating and shopping choices. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: jmlewis21
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay while in Baltimore on business. Assuming you have a car, this is a great location to do business and relax afterwards. Right across the street from the mall and several eateries. Will definitely visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't recommend”
Reviews.Author: houbest
Reviews.Content: Arrived for a sports tournament on a Friday afternoon. Asked for 2 queen, was told by supervisor that none were available so checked into king room. Went online and found they had additional king rooms available. Went back down to desk to ask for additional king room. Was told there was a 2 queen room available by another employee which I was able to get. All this within 20 minutes. Rooms are sparse. No fridge or microwave, small desk. Asked for late checkout (additional hour) on morning of checkout. Told by supervisor wasn't possible as about 20 people had already asked. Informed her that I was a Gold Elite member which she said didn't make a difference. Next time will stay at Hilton Garden down street when returning to area.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here...”
Reviews.Author: Dynasty007
Reviews.Content: Good stay, requests all met. Was here for a graduation, perfect location to shopping, food, and highway. People were friendly, room clean. This was actually my 2nd time staying here. If I need to return,I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very New and Clean”
Reviews.Author: ziggyziggy
Reviews.Content: This hotel may have a 2.5 star rating but I would rather stay here than most other hotels with higher star ratings. Remember that more stars does not always mean a better hotel. It just means the hotel has higher prices and more "luxurious" amenities such as better brand shampoos. This hotel was pretty new when we visited. It has been opened for less than a year or something. The parking lot was plentiful for all the guests. Upon entering the lobby late at night, we were greeted by a friendly person behind the desk. Check in was a breeze and there was even free lemon water inside a glass jug. This ldea was new to us and impressed us right from the start. The rooms are nice and new. They are also very clean. They give the sense of good housekeeping. The sheets are clean and so is the bathroom. We felt confident in the overall cleanliness so we slept well. For a simple trip with nothing fancy, this is a great hotel. The breakfast was decent in the morning, not nearly as good as the food offered in the Residence Inn chain but that is in a whole different class and price point. Again, this is not the first Fairfield Inn we have been to and are impressed by them again.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly service & ticked all the boxes for our stay”
Reviews.Author: ace1337
Reviews.Content: My partner & I have been travelling the U.S. and stayed 2 nights in the Fairfield I&S, White Marsh. The friendly service was the best of all the hotels we have stayed in so far, and the hotel met all of our needs perfectly... including: Great continental breakfast in the morning Complimentary laundry machines & detergent Nice, but small, fitness center Good sized rooms, kept very clean Complimentary shuttle to the surrounding mall There isn't much to do in the area, but our stay was just as a stop-over on the way to Washington, D.C. Thanks to all the friendly and helpful staff. If every hotel was run like this we'd never have any complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: NYCitygirl79
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this review by saying that I received a voucher for a free night from a recent horrible experience at ANOTHER Fairfield Inn & Suites. So when I made plans for a mother-daughter overnight trip, I used the voucher for this hotel. This hotel is located right off of I-95 and in a well populated area with hospitals, shopping centers, stores and restaurants. It is one of the first hotels in the development, very easy to find, right next to a gas station, a McDonald's and a Taco Bell. The parking lot always had plenty of spaces, check-in was a breeze, all staff we encountered were very nice and accomodating. The lobby was beautiful, with plenty of seating and as is customary in Marriott brand hotels, hot tea and coffee 24/7. The room was very bright and comfortable. My only gripe was the channel selection on the TV was limited and there was a fuzzy reception on some cable channels. There was no fan in the bathroom but the mirror cleared up pretty quickly once the bathroom door was open. My only complaint (and it's not really a complaint) is that the location of the hotel is still far out from the harbor. Every restaurant or business we went to in that area was at least 20 minutes away each way by car. But the hotel was great, quiet, excellent for our needs and our standards. The only issue is the beds were a bit uncomfortable but that didn't stop me from having a good night's sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: kupse
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here on our return trip from Florida. We were a bit anxious as our previous night at a Marriott in Florence, South Carolina was not a pleasant stay and considered canceling and staying at another chain hotel. Everything from our arrival to our departure was great. The room was very nice, clean and in a great location. Easy access off and on I-95 and many options for dining in area. We are so happy we did not let the experience the night before make us change our reservations. Will definitely stay here again and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice pre-cruise hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Iridescentkittie
Reviews.Content: My entire extended family (26 people in total) took a group cruise in early April, and I arranged for us all to stay at this hotel the night prior to our cruise. We got a great "park and cruise" rate that allowed us to leave our cars at the hotel and take a free shuttle back and forth to the port. Note about that: Some of us paid for the park & cruise rate, while others carpooled with family and paid for a regular room. Each park & cruise room covers up to 4 people on the shuttle, so those family members who had regular rooms were able to "share" with park & cruise people to take the shuttle. Good to know! The hotel staff was excellent before we even arrived, politely answering all our questions and making arrangements for those with medical needs. They called us several days before our stay to set us up with times for the shuttle ride down to the port in an organized manner. The hotel itself is still very new-looking, everything is bright and cheerful. We had a regular king-size room (not a suite), and it was nice - flat screen tv, comfortable bed with extra pillows, plenty of closet space, and a large bathroom that was immaculately clean. (I've never seen such a clean hotel bathroom!) My only complaint about the room was that our bed did not have a comforter - only several layers of sheets - so we were cold. We had to turn the heat up in our room at night! Luckily, the room had a regular digital thermostat, so very easy to control and solve that problem! The complimentary breakfast in the morning was very good - waffles, Jimmy Dean breakfast sandwiches, pastries, cereal, oatmeal, juice, etc. A nice little seating area in which to enjoy your meal. The hotel is nicely located near many fast food and sit-down restaurant options. Just outside the hotel doors are a McDonalds and a Taco Bell, and a mall with shopping and restaurants is about 2 minutes away by car. There is also a small "Market" inside the hotel selling convenience-store food and drink items. There is a small business center in the lobby with free printing - useful for boarding passes and maps. We did not use the outdoor swimming pool as it was too cold, but it looked nice. I have only one complaint, and it concerns the shuttle service to the port! (I believe this is an outside shuttle company that the hotel contracts with, so please keep that in mind.) Because we were traveling with such a large group, we were split into 3 shuttles at 3 separate times. One shuttle was to contain a regular amount of passengers PLUS a wheelchair, a wedding dress, and several garment bags containing tuxedos. The hotel assured us that they would have the largest of the shuttle vans available for us. Well, they did bring the larger shuttle, but for the wrong shuttle time! It came and went, and when it was time for the wedding baggage to go to port, there wasn't enough room and some people had to stay behind and wait for the next shuttle. It was an inconvenience and was not a pleasant way to start the day. I will say, though, that everyone made it to port on time along with their luggage and it ended up being fine. Because of this experience on the way down to port, we were worried about taking the shuttle back to the hotel after our cruise. However, this time it went very smoothly! They had enough shuttles for everyone waiting at the port when we docked, and we were back to our cars in no time at all. I suspect that the problem we experienced with the shuttle had to do with the fact that we were such a large party. I caution those traveling in large groups to check and double check that your group will be accommodated by the shuttle! But for those traveling with fewer people (couples and small families), I highly recommend this hotel! And if you aren't doing a park-and-cruise and are just looking for a hotel stay, then by all means, this is an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, new hotel with excellent staff--highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: LizB_71
Reviews.Content: We stopped at this hotel to spend the night on our drive back to Connecticut from Florida. We checked in at 11:30pm and despite the late hour the gentleman at the front desk, Sam, was great. He saw that we had two young children who were sleepy and cranky so he gave them each Nickelodeon braceletes! It was a small guesture that made a huge difference in our night. We had made our reservation through Marriot Rewards reservation line only 30 minutes earlier, but he had our reservation all ready and needed only to confirm my credit card (for incidentals, we were using reward points) and hand me our room keys. He said he knew we'd probably be tired and need to get to our rooms quickly. The housekeeping staff was nearby and quickly found a luggage cart for us so we could get everything we needed to our rooms easily. The hotel was very clean. The room was spacious with comfortable beds (extra pillows!). It is conveniently located right off of Route 95, but very quiet. The complimentary breakfast was very good with fresh belgian waffles, pastries, fruit, oatmeal, etc... everything you need for a full breakfast. I even saw the staff get hard boiled eggs for a guest who'd requested them. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Nichie2
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight as a quick getaway (attempting to beat cabin fever). Very "modern" decor. Upbeat colors, nice lobby. Check in staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was clean, and comfortable, but not huge. Large bathroom was nice. Staff called and checked in to be sure we had all of our needs met. Continental breakfast is always appreciated. Options were not fabulous, but plenty, including fresh waffles, bagels/pastries and cereals. Would definitely stay here again. Location was close to lots of shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Park and Cruise”
Reviews.Author: lporambo
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel to go on our cruise. The hotel contacted me in regards to our shuttle to the cruise port. The hotel was great and our shuttle arrived on time to take us to the port. The driver on our trip to our cruise was great. She laughed about the amount of luggage we brought since I had overpacked (of course). On our return trip after our cruise we called for the shuttle to come get us and they were there in less than 10 munutes. Overall it was much easier and to come down the night before and stay at the hotel and let them shuttle us to port and the cost was just a little over just parking at the port. Breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: henson4823
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great and the hotel staff was excellent. Breakfast was provided each morning and evening activities were offered throughout the week. One night, they hosted a free cookout with beer/wine. There was space to meet with colleagues in the evenings and the rooms provided comfortable sleep. I would highly recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Lyn60
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight at this hotel so that we would be close to Johns Hopkins hospital for an early AM Dr. appt. The hotel was very clean. Check-in was effortless. The continental breakfast was good. Beds were comfortable. It was close to the hospital and we were given somewhat of a discount as a JH patient rate. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would rate the Hotel an 8 out of 10”
Reviews.Author: Celling
Reviews.Content: Great hotel very nice accomodations and very newish Marriott rooms. I have stayed there before and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Nice Stop Over”
Reviews.Author: MaThreesisters
Reviews.Content: Loved it!! We were driving to Boston from Orlando, and stopped there for the night. It's located right off 95, with many fast foods/restaurants closeby for dinner. It was very clean and spacious. The staff was very friendly, and the free internet and breakfast was a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: tej2800
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay. It's on the same level with most Marriott Courtyards but I have a few gripes about this place. Gripes - The crack clearance underneath the front door was too high. I heard voices in the hallway at night while I was trying to sleep. I had to put a towel under the front door to dampen out the noise. In addition, when I came back to the hotel from dinner, I heard the guy next door nailing his girlfriend WHILE I WAS STAND IN THE HALLWAY. Simply put, the clearance under the door that leads to the guestroom is too high. - The air-condition units are too noisy. It was hard to get sleep. Positives: - Clean Hotel -Lots of eateries next door such as Taco Bell, Wendy's and McDonalds. There is also an Exxon Gas Station nearby. **Choose the Marriott Courtyard at Rypken Stadium.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: PatriceNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Our family was very happy staying at the Fairfield Inn White Marsh. The services was friendly and professional, the room was exceptionally clean and up to date decor and the compimentary breakfast was great. My kids especially enjoyed the cookies at night. My daughter left a pillow her great grandmother had made for her before she passed away and my daughter takes it everywhere we go as a security blanket. She left it at the hotel the morning we checked out. I called the hotel and they were very helpful. They left a message with the head of house keeping and Adam called me to tell me they found the pillow and was sending it right out. I, along with my daughter and the rest of my family truly appreciate the dedication of Adam and the staff at the Fairfield Inn at White Marsh. I would recommend staying with them if you are looking to visit the Inner Harbor or an Orioles game at Camden Yard. They are conveniently located to all main attractions. Their shuttle service was top notch also. The vans were clean, well maintained and the drivers were very friendly. We would definitely say there again. Patrice, NJ

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott I Have Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: 76philly
Reviews.Content: Clean, Clean, Clean. The staff is exceptional. Katie runs a five star hotel in fine staff, clean accomodations, great breakfast area, free trolley service to restaurants and stores and free Wednesday cookouts.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest Fairfield That I Have Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: tigsbaseball
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel in a great location, near shopping, restaurants and not far from Baltimore. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful in every way. They always had fresh fruit and fresh baked cookies to offer at the front desk. The morning breakfast was great. We asked for a lower floor room and were pleased when we were given our room on the first floor. The hotel seems like it is new and VERY clean. The only negative (and its a small, picky point) is that the pool is somewhat small but still adequate for our needs. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel in every way. Great value too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: FMDtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for business. First impression, the hotel is immaculate. The lobby is very welcoming and the staff was very courteous and helpful. Check in was a breeze. They gave me my choice of room. The room was very clean, had a nice flat screen and free wireless internet - all things that are very important to me as a business traveler. The bathroom was very clean too. Tucked away in suburbia, it was not hard to find anything I needed. The White Marsh Mall was very close, but I recommend you visit a place across the street from the mall, called The Avenue. It's like an outdoor mall in the form of a modern town square. I had my choice of restaurants, cafes, and shops. I ate at the Red Brick Station Restaurant where they brew their own beers. The area is easy to navigate and clearly very, very safe. Also close to 95, a very quick trip to and from BWI and Downtown Baltimore. Finally, for breakfast, the breakfast bar was great! The breakfast area had a nice flat screen and plenty of private seating. I had two Dunkin Donuts (which I noticed were from Dunkin Donuts because I could see the boxes hidden) and the coffee was good. They had Belgian waffle makers which smelled amazing, fresh fruits, other assorted pastries, bagels, yogurts, juices, milks, etc. It was quite a display. Check out was just as easy. They extended to me a late check-out, even though I didn't need it. Check out is at noon so there is less chance you'll be needing one anyway. Overall, great stay and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Fairfield I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: 30-StateTraveler
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this is the only hotel shown in "White Marsh., MD" reviews. There is a Residence Inn on the same street and a Hilton Garden Inn and Hampton a block away...but in any case this is the nicest Fairfield Inn I've ever stayed at. I'd put it up against any Marriott Courtyard or SpringHill Suites and it's every bit as nice as the HGI and Hampton up the street. Very friendly, quality construction and here's a rarity: Flat Screen HD TV's AND the HD channels to go with it! Lot's of restaurants and shopping nearby. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, quiet”
Reviews.Author: longislanddebbi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when we dropped our daughter off at Loyola College. Our first impression was how friendly the staff is! When we forgot toothpaste, they personally brought it to our room and it wasn't a small little tube but a good size tube. The room was spacious and very clean. The location is great--right off of 95 but quiet and close to a big mall with lots of choices of restaurants. My only little suggestion would be to spruce up breakfast. Danish, toast, make-your-own waffles, cereal, and fruit are great but perhaps eggs and bacon/sausage can be added too. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend this hotel to red sox fans driving to baltimore”
Reviews.Author: soxfan60
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Excellent location. Nice, helpful staff. Off I-95, next to a mall, but very quiet. Beds were very comfortable. Hotel is just north of Baltimore, about 15 minutes to Camden Yards. Easy access from I-95. We took a day trip to beautiful and historical Annapolis about 45minutes away. Everything about this hotel was excellent from cleanliness to the buffet breakfast. My family and I highly recommend it and will definitely use it again. A great value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: jamy208
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while visiting friends in the Baltimore area. I didn't realize it was a brand new hotel at the time. However, everything was great. Nice, clean, comfortable room. Beds are to die for. Very helpful front desk staff. I had a problem hooking up my portable DVD player to the TV and one of the guys from the front desk went above and beyond to get it worked out for me. Would definitely recommend it to anyone.

HotelInfo.Name: Fairfield Inn & Suites Baltimore White Marsh
HotelInfo.Address: 8477 Cordon Way, Baltimore, MD 21236
